title: docs: model: tutorials: Improve
body:
1. `run.py` with SLRModel (essentially quickstart)
  - Refer them to plugins page
2. `run.py` with andother model from plugins page
3. Make sure above each code block says the file name
  - One file is better
4. `SimpleModel` is not simple, it's advanced, you're rolling your own


Format: Here's what I'm going to build, show how to build it one line at a time


- Start with run.py
  - Show how we switch from built in model to one we write ourselves

- No math, maybe replace all this with scikit
- One file
- Do not use `from`
- Can we remove the use of `entrypoint`?
- No type hinting
- Remove accuracy method
- SimpleModel should just pickle all properties
  - Remove storage

- myslr:MySLRModel explain how no .py because it's all Python
- explain command line flags

- Sources methods to create arrays of data
  - Method to return pandas dataframe
  - with_features should take *args: str
- Explain why sources and why features and what each class is

- Explain config and why we use it, how it makes it

- Explain how to do pre-preocessing
  - Need to be able to drop
  - Example of spiting date into YYYY MM DD features (also weekday)
- Create a default preprocessing flow that cleans up data
  - Fill in blanks with average
  - etc. config for this to make it a bit better

- cross validation
